content: our second version of our hand in hand cowl pattern continues the celebration of yarns that work well together this cowl is a deceptively simple two-color garter stitch piece with a touch of shaping that allows it to sit just right around your neck -- perfect for your stash of lightweight and fluffy yarns samples shown hot pink spincycle yarns dyed in the wool in color pinky swear mc and dimond laine birdie in color pop rocks cc shown in the 13 5 length neon yellow dimond laine elmer fingering in color sweatshirt mc and dimond laine birdie in color fetch cc shown in the 20 5 length sizes two lengths 13 5 20 5 finished measurements approx 26 circumference at bottom tapering to 18 circumference at top x 13 5 20 5 tall yarn requirements *please note these are yarn estimates the amount used will depend on your yarn your personal gauge and any modifications you make * mc spincycle yarns dyed in the wool 100% american wool 200 yards per 50 grams or dimond laine elmer fingering 80% merino 20% cashmere 205 yards per 50 grams 1 2 skein s cc dimond laine biride 74% alpaca 26% silk 328 yards per 50 grams 1 1 skein or fingering-weight yarns in the following amounts mc 165 250 yards / 150 228 m cc 145 175 yards / 132 160 m needles *needles listed are suggested * gauge needle us 5 3 75mm 16 / 40cm circular needles smaller needle optional for bind-off us 4 3 5mm 16 / 40cm circular needle or one size smaller than gauge needle tools bor marker darning needle gauge approx 20 stitches and 26 rounds in two-color garter stitch in the round using gauge needle blocked
